description: This file defines the IndiceFragment class, a Kotlin source file for an Android app fragment that provides a UI with three Call-To-Action buttons and a menu button for instructions. It handles focus navigation via DPAD keys, sets up click listeners to navigate to other fragments, and manages UI initialization.

classes.name: IndiceFragment
classes.description: An Android Fragment that displays an index screen with three CTA buttons and an instructions button, supporting keyboard navigation and fragment transactions.

methods.name: newInstance
methods.description: Creates and returns a new instance of IndiceFragment.

methods.name: onCreateView
methods.description: Inflates the fragment's layout from XML.

methods.name: onViewCreated
methods.description: Initializes UI elements, sets text, focus, and event handlers after the view is created.

methods.name: setupFocusTransitions
methods.description: Configures focus navigation IDs among buttons to ensure vertical movement.

methods.name: openPrototype
methods.description: Replaces the current fragment with a prototype fragment based on index.

methods.name: openInstrucciones
methods.description: Replaces the current fragment with the instrucciones fragment.
